title: From Text to Data
text:
Materials

Data
The Eternal Feminine (L’Éternel Féminin), Paul Cezanne, c.1877





Getty Museum



Provenance
Ambroise Vollard, French, 1867–1939; Auguste Pellerin, 1852–1929 (Paris, France), by inheritance to Jean-Victor Pellerin, 1929. Jean-Victor Pellerin (Paris, France), sold to Wildenstein & Co., 1955. Wildenstein & Co. (New York), sold to Stavros S. Niarchos, 1956. Stavros S. Niarchos, 1908–1996 (Paris, France), sold to Wildenstein & Co., 1958. Wildenstein & Co. (New York), sold to Harold Hecht, 1959. Harold Hecht, American, 1907–1985 (Beverly Hills, California), sold to Wildenstein & Co., 1962. Wildenstein & Co. (New York), sold to Mrs. John Goulandris, 1973. Mrs. John Goulandris (New York, New York). Galerie Beyeler, founded 1952, dissolved 2011 (Basel, Switzerland), sold to the J. Paul Getty Museum, 1987.

title: Coding Provenance. Lab & Friends
text:
Welcome to our workshop Coding Provenance for Lab & Friends!
Think of this as a crash course with a twist: we’ll dive into coding, data cleaning, analysis, and visualization in a fun, hands-on way. By the end of the session, you’ll have shaken off the fear of coding and feel empowered to tackle these tasks on your own with confidence!



Date: September 24, 2025

Time: 11:00–13:00 — lunch break — 14:00–18:00

Location: Leuphana University Room: C.40.108





Knowledge Design
Learning the Language
From Text to Data
Data Preprocessing
Exploratory Analysis & Visualisation




This workshop requires only very basic tech skills to the extend of having using a computer before. You won’t need to install any software, since everything will run in the cloud.
The idea behind this workshop is simple: you don’t need fancy setups or extraordinary tools to start doing fun coding things!






Checklist




Bring your own laptop

Have a Google account ready

Use ChatGPT (free version)

If you don’t already have an account, you can sign up using Proton Mail, a free, privacy-friendly email service.









Email: barbara.romero_ferron(at)leuphana.de

title: Exploratory Analysis & Visualisation
text:
Basic Statistical Analysis
Introduction to Information Visualisation
Bonus: Network Analysis :D

title: Exploratory Analysis & Visualisation
text:
Materials
For this session we will need four datasets (two json and two csv). For the second part of this session we also need to download and install gephi.

Data
MOMI All Data Contains information about artworks and their provenance events (e.g., creation, acquisition, sales). Each record links an object to a sequence of events over time.






Data Dictionary





MOMI Data Dictionary








Variable
Description
Example




_id
Internal numeric identifier for the record.
1


MOMI_id
Unique MoMi identifier for the artwork.
MOMI_2


title
Title of the artwork.
The Artist’s Studio, Rue Visconti, Paris (Primary Title)


author
Creator/artist, sometimes with external ID (ULAN).
Bazille, Frédéric [ulan:500004356]


institution
Current holding institution.
Virginia Museum of Fine Arts


url
Link to the object’s online record.
https://www.vmfa.museum/...


date
Creation date or year of the artwork.
1867


place
Place of creation (may be blank).
Paris / ``


accessionID
Accession/catalogue number in the institution.
83.4


provenance
Free-text provenance statement.
"Collection of André Bazille... Gift to VMFA in 1983."


notes
Additional curatorial or archival notes.
"Sold on February 14, 1961. See VMFA Curatorial file."


creditLine
Acquisition credit line.
"Collection of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Mellon"


inscriptions
Inscriptions on the artwork.
"Not signed."


exhibitions
List of exhibitions where the artwork was shown.
"2019: Van Gogh, Monet, Degas..."


bibliography
References and publications.
"Tiller, Bertrand. Vues d’atelier. Paris, 2014."


medium
Material/technique.
"oil on canvas"


dimensions
Physical dimensions, framed/unframed.
"25 1/2 × 19 in. (64.77 × 48.26 cm)"


image
Link to image file.
https://vmfa-dmz-new.piction.com/...


WD
Wikidata ID and label.
Q19962601___The Artist’s Studio...


snapshotDate
Date of record snapshot.
2021-10-17


status
Status of the record.
"Automatically Acquired"


provenanceData
Structured provenance events (nested JSON). Includes:  - activityCertainty  - activityType (Creation, Acquisition, Gift, etc.)  - activityTimeString / activityTimeEDTF  - assertionAuthor  - assertionNotes  - parties (with party ID and role: agent, sender, receiver).
Example event: "activityType": "aat:300417637__Gift", "activityTimeString": "May 1983", "parties": [{"id": "...", "role": "sender"}]


active
Boolean flag indicating if the record is active.
"true"






MOMI Parties Contains information about the parties (collectors, dealers, artists, institutions, etc.) involved in those provenance events, as well as their relationships and roles.






Data Dictionary





MOMI Parties Data Dictionary








Variable
Description
Example




_id
Internal unique identifier (string) for the party.
"ZuW1191362122"


id
Same as _id, used as reference key in other files.
"ZuW1191362122"


label
Display label, usually prefixed with # and the party’s name.
"#André Bazille"


type
Type of party: person, group, institution, etc.
"person", "group"


gender
Gender of the person (AAT vocabulary).
"aat:300411836" (male), "aat:300411837" (female)


ULAN
ULAN identifier and label if available.
"ulan/500304375___Wildenstein and Co., Inc."


WD
Wikidata identifier and label if available.
"Q4013975___Virginia Museum of Fine Arts..."


birthTimeString
Birth year or date in human-readable string.
"1860"


birthTimeEDTF
Birth year/date in EDTF format.
"1860", "1934-03-27"


deathTimeString
Death year/date in human-readable string.
"1922"


deathTimeEDTF
Death year/date in EDTF format.
"1922"


groupTypes
List of controlled terms describing group type.
["aat:300443854__art dealerships"]


names
Alternative or variant names with type and value.
{"type": "aat:300417226__alternative titles", "value": "Kunstsalon Schames"}


locations
List of associated locations, sometimes with Wikidata links, city, country, province, and an id.
{"city": "Frankfurt am Main", "country": "Germany", "WD": "Q1794..."}


relations
List of relationships to other parties: includes relation id, related party id, and relation type (ULAN relation vocab).
{"party": "iXw1994820523", "type": "gvp:ulan1541_spouse_of__spouse of"}






Royal families dataset Nodes Edges


Presentation
You can follow the presentation here.

 Presentation 



Bibliography + Resources
Dataviz Project. https://datavizproject.com/
Visualizing Historical Network https://histecon.fas.harvard.edu/visualizing/
Cosmograph. https://cosmograph.app/
Network Science. http://networksciencebook.com/
Fraiberger, S. P., Sinatra, R., Resch, M., Riedl, C., & Barabási, A.-L. (2018). Quantifying Reputation and Success in Art. Science, 362(6416), 825–829. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.aau7224
Huemer, C. (2019). The Provenance of Provenances. In Jane C. Milosch, Nick Pearce (eds.), Collecting & Provenance: A Multidisciplinary Approach. Rowman & Littlefield. https://www.academia.edu/43252971/The_Provenance_of_Provenances
Lincoln, M. D. (2020). Tangled Metaphors: Network Thinking and Network Analysis in the History of Art. In The Routledge Companion to Digital Humanities and Art History. Routledge.
Schich, M., Huemer, C., Adamczyk, P., Manovich, L., & Liu, Y. Y. (2017). Network dimensions in the getty provenance index. arXiv preprint arXiv:1706.02804.

title: Knowledge Design
text:
Structure the Data – define formats and standards.
Build Ontologies – establish meaning and relationships.
Interrogate the Datasets – evaluate biases, gaps, and context.

title: Knowledge Design
text:
Materials

Data
For the first activity, review these different archival sources and imagine that you need to design a data model for a tabular database (a spreadsheet). What variables/columns would you include?

Stock book Sample
Catalogue Raisonné Sample
Exhibition Catalogue Sample
Correspondence Sample



Presentation
You can follow the presentation here.

 Presentation 



Bibliography & Resources
Data Feminism — Catherine D’Ignazio & Lauren F. Klein (2023). MIT Press. https://data-feminism.mitpress.mit.edu/
CARE Principles for Indigenous Data Governance — Global Indigenous Data Alliance (2019). https://www.gida-global.org/care — Principios CARE para pueblos indígenas.
Data Epistemologies, the Coloniality of Power, and Resistance — P. Ricaurte (2019). Television & New Media, 20(4), 350–365. https://doi.org/10.1177/1527476419831640
Linked Art — Linked Art Community (s. f.). https://linked.art/ — Modelo de datos e interoperabilidad para arte.
CIDOC-CRM, Version 7.3 — CIDOC CRM Special Interest Group (s. f.). https://cidoc-crm.org/Version/version-7.3
The FAIR Guiding Principles for scientific data management and stewardship — Mark D. Wilkinson, Michel Dumontier, IJsbrand Jan Aalbersberg, Gabrielle Appleton, Myles Axton, Arie Baak, et al. (2016). Scientific Data, 3, 160018. https://doi.org/10.1038/sdata.2016.18
W3C PROV: Provenance Documentation — W3C (s. f.). https://www.w3.org/TR/prov-overview/ — Modelo de procedencia (PROV).
